cyclone.name: NATE
cyclone.current_location: about 25 miles SSW of San Andres Island
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to move northwest across Nicaragua and Honduras, then turn north-northwest over the north-western Caribbean and Gulf of Mexico toward the central U.S. Gulf Coast.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the Mississippi–Alabama Gulf Coast (close to Pascagoula, MS)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Warning in effect from Sandy Bay Sirpi, Nicaragua to Punta Castilla, Honduras
weather_observation.warning_coast: Same as watch area – Central America (Nicaragua–Honduras coast)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Central U.S. Gulf Coast from southeastern Louisiana through Mississippi and Alabama to the western Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (with a chance of hurricane-force gusts) are possible along the Mississippi coast including Pascagoula as the system approaches Sunday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential storm surge of 3–6 ft above ground level along the Mississippi–Alabama coastline, including Pascagoula Harbor.
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rainfall of 4–8 inches with locally higher amounts possible near and east of where the center crosses the coast.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous seas and high waves in approaches and anchorages; isolated tornadoes in outer rain bands.
